column1: Westlake Village is a city in Los Angeles County on its western border with Ventura County. The city is named after the master-planned community of Westlake Village. With a lake at the center
column2: the community straddles the line between Los Angeles and Ventura counties. Roughly two-thirds of the community was annexed by the city of Thousand Oaks. In 1981
column3: the remaining portion incorporated into the City of Westlake Village which became the 82nd municipality of Los Angeles County. The population of the city was estimated to be at 8
Chumash Indians moved into the region and lived by hunting rabbits and other game
column4: and gathering grains and acorns. On-going excavations
column6: and polychrome rock paintings in the area provide a glimpse into the social and economic complexity of the ancient Chumash world.It is unknown when the first people settled in the area. A Chumash village was settled here in 500 BCE
column7: known as Hipuc. The Chumash Indians gathered and prepared acorns and other seeds. These were collected in the fall. The Chumash also hunted wild animals
column8: fish and gathered plants. Their diet consisted of acorns
column15: and seeds. They made their clothing from the skins of animals such as rabbits
column17: and sea otters. Women wore long skirts weaved from grass or soft bark
column18: while men wore pieces of deerskin tied around their waists. Both men and women painted designs on their bodies and wore shell beads.On a return trip from Northern California in January 1770
column19: a group of men led by Gaspar de Portola are believed to be the first Europeans to encounter the Chumash Indians in the Conejo Valley. Father Juan Crespi
column20: chaplain and diarist of the expedition
column22: a Chumash village. He wrote that there was plenty of water and firewood in the village
column23: and that the land was covered with pastures. He wrote: "We are on a plain of considerable extent and much beauty
column24: forested on all parts by live oaks and oak trees
column25: with much pasturage and water." Crespi named the place El triunfo del Dulcísimo Nombre de Jesús (in English: The Triumph of the Sweetest Name of Jesus) to a camping place by a creek.

column2: including Satwiwa and two villages by where Ventu Park Road is in Newbury Park. These Chumash villages are believed by archeologists to have first been settled over 2
column3: 000 years ago. Another village was located by Lake Sherwood.In 1795

column1: At the time California was admitted to the union in 1850
column2: most of the land that later became Ventura County was divided among only 19 families. Rising knolls
column3: arroyos
column4: barrancas and ancient oaks were found on two Mexican land grants: Rancho El Conejo and Rancho Las Virgenes.In 1881
column5: the Russell brothers purchased a large portion of the land for cattle ranching. According to Patricia Allen
column7: Andrew Russell beat the competition in buying the land by racing across 6
column8: 000 acres (24 km2) on a fifteen-minute trip in a buckboard and sealed the deal with a $20 gold piece. The price per acre was $2.50. The area continued to be known as the Russell Ranch although it was sold in 1925 to William Randolph Hearst and again in 1943 to Fred Albertson. The Russell family leased back part of the land to continue its successful cattle ranch operation while the Albertson Company used the vast area as a movie ranch. Many movies and television shows were filmed in the Conejo Valley
column14: Gunsmoke and Bonanza. The 1940 film Danger Ahead was filmed on Westlake Boulevard.

column5: commissioned the preparation of a master plan by architectural and planning firm A. C. Martin and Associates. This new "city in the country" planned to have a firm economic base including commercial areas
column7: and ample green space with the lake as a focal point.   Prominent architects
column9: and land planners participated in designing the new community
column10: a prominent example of planned 1960s-style suburbanism.The original tract was divided by the Los Angeles/Ventura county line. In 1968 and 1972
column11: two portions of the Westlake development consisting of 8
column12: 544 acres (35 km2) on the Ventura County side were annexed into the city of Thousand Oaks. In 1981
column14: 456 acres (13.99 km2) or roughly 1/3) of the Westlake master-planned community was incorporated as the City of Westlake Village. California state law prevents a city from existing in two separate counties.

column1: Much of Westlake Village is surrounded by open space
column3: as well as the vast Santa Monica Mountains National Recreation Area. The town is in the northwestern Santa Monica Mountains area
column4: and is 9 miles (14 km) inland from the Pacific Ocean. The lake lies within the watershed of Malibu Creek. Water from the lake must be released into the creek in compliance with an agreement between the California State Water Resources Control Board and the Westlake Lake Management Association
column5: a private entity that oversees the operation of the lake.In addition to being a bedroom community for Los Angeles via the Ventura (101) Freeway
column6: it is also home to many large commercial offices and the headquarters of the Dole Food Company
column7: K-Swiss and J.D. Power and Associates. The western region office (Region 5) of Anheuser-Busch Inc. is also located in the community. The Ventura Freeway is one of three of Westlake's lifelines to Los Angeles and Ventura; the Pacific Coast Highway
column8: and the Ronald Reagan (118) Freeway also run nearby. It is a short drive to the nearest mall in Thousand Oaks.

column1: The City of Westlake Village is located approximately 40 miles (64 km) West of downtown Los Angeles in the Conejo Valley. Other communities in the surrounding area include Thousand Oaks

column1: Coastal breezes seep through canyons to allow Westlake to sometimes be up to 10 degrees cooler and considerably less hazy than nearby San Fernando Valley during the summer months. However
column2: it generally remains 10 degrees hotter than the coastal plains below the Conejo Grade
column3: in the communities of Santa Rosa Valley

column1: Dole Food Company is headquartered in Westlake Village. In 1994
column2: Dole announced that it would finalize its plans to build its world headquarters on a 30-acre (120
column3: 000 m2) site owned by the company
column4: located north of the Ventura Freeway in Westlake Village. The decision had been delayed by groundwater contamination tests and reviewing of possible site plan revisions. Dole was expected to submit its plans for final approval by the Westlake Village City Council on February 9
column7: PennyMac Loan Services and Ryland Homes also have their headquarters in Westlake Village.

column1: In the state legislature Westlake Village is located in California's 27th State Senate district

column1: The community is in the Las Virgenes Unified School District (LVUSD). Residents are zoned to White Oak Elementary School in Westlake Village
column2: Lindero Canyon Middle School in Agoura Hills
column3: and Agoura High School in Agoura Hills.An off-campus center of California Lutheran University is located in Westlake Village.
